contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = One Moment More | Type = studio | Longtype = | Artist = [[Mindy Smith]] | Cover = Mindy Smith - One Moment More.jpg | Released = January 27, 2004 | Recorded = | Genre = folk, country, americana, pop | Length = 45:59 | Label = [[Vanguard Records]] | Producer = Steve Buckingham, Mindy Smith | Chronology = | Last album = | This album = '''''One Moment More'''''<br/>2004 | Next album = ''[[Long Island Shores]]''<br/>2006 }} {{album ratings|noprose=yes | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r671163|tab=review|first=Mark|last=Deming|accessdate=March 12, 2012}}</ref> }} '''''One Moment More''''' is the debut [[Album (music)|album]] by [[United States|American]] [[singer-songwriter]] [[Mindy Smith]], released in [[2004 in music|2004]]. ==Track listing== #"Come to Jesus" – 4:14 #"Falling" – 3:35 #"Raggedy Ann" – 4:55 #"Fighting for It All" – 3:19 #"Train Song" – 3:22 #"It's Amazing" – 3:40 #"Angel Doves" – 3:56 #"Down in Flames" – 4:12 #"Hurricane" – 3:33 #"Hard to Know" – 3:06 #"One Moment More" – 3:47 #"Jolene" ([[Dolly Parton]]) – 4:20 '''Notes:''' *All songs were written by Mindy Smith except for "Jolene." *"Jolene," "Come to Jesus" and "One Moment More" were all released as singles. ==Personnel== *Mindy Smith - [[Singing|vocals]], harmony vocals *David Angell - [[violin]] *Steve Buckingham - [[Appalachian dulcimer|dulcimer]], [[Steel-string guitar|acoustic guitar]], [[electric guitar]], [[Hammond organ]] *[[Chris Carmichael (musician)|Chris Carmichael]] - violin, [[cello]], [[viola]] *Steve Conn - [[accordion]], Hammond organ *John Deaderick - [[piano]], [[keyboard instrument|keyboard]] *[[Dan Dugmore]] - [[steel guitar]], [[lap steel guitar]] *Connie Ellisor - violin *Shannon Forrest - [[Drum kit|drums]] *Paul Griffith - [[percussion instrument|percussion]], drums *Jim Grosjean - viola *David Jacques - [[bass guitar|bass]] *Will Kimbrough - electric guitar *[[Viktor Krauss]] - bass *[[Sonny Landreth]] - slide guitar *[[Dolly Parton]] - harmony vocals *Lex Price - [[mandolin]] *[[Matt Rollings]] - Hammond organ *Pamela Sixfin - violin *[[Bryan Sutton]] - acoustic guitar, [[guitar]] *Daniel Tashian - harmony vocals *Kathryn Vanosdale - violin *Kenny Vaughan - electric guitar *Kristin Wilkinson - viola *Glenn Worf - bass ==Production== *Producers: Steve Buckingham, Mindy Smith *Engineers: Scott Baggett, Neal Cappellino, Paul Hart, Marshall Morgan, Gary Paczosa, Bart Pursley *Assistant engineers: Paul Hart, Thomas Johnson *Mixing: Gary Paczosa *Mastering: Robert Hadley, Doug Sax *Production assistant: Renee White *Creative services coordinator: Georgette Cartwright *String arrangements: Kristin Wilkinson *Design: Gina R. Binkley *Photography: Marina Chavez ==Charts== '''Album''' - [[Billboard magazine|Billboard]] (North America) {| border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 width="550px" !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Chart !align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|2004 |align="left"|The Billboard 200 |align="left"|143 |- |align="left"|2004 |align="left"|Top Heatseekers |align="left"|2 |- |align="left"|2004 |align="left"|Top Independent Albums |align="left"|6 |- |align="left"|2004 |align="left"|Top Internet Albums |align="left"|165 |- |} '''Singles''' - Billboard (North America) {| border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 width="550px" !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Single !align="left"|Chart !align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|2004 |align="left"|"Come to Jesus" |align="left"|Adult Top 40 |align="left"|35 |- |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Mindy Smith}} [[Category:Mindy Smith albums]] [[Category:2004 debut albums]] [[Category:Vanguard Records albums]]
